title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 360-7.2 - MA program as payment source of last resort
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 360-7.2 - MA program as payment source of last resort

State Regulations

Where a third party, such as a health insurer or
responsible person, has a legal liability to pay for MA-covered services on
behalf of a recipient, the department or social services district will pay only
the amount by which the MA reimbursement rate for the services exceeds the
amount of the third party liability. The department or social services district
will also pay if the third party payment will not be made within a reasonable
time. The department or social services district will seek reimbursement for
any payments for care and services it makes for which a third party is legally
responsible. They will seek reimbursement to the extent of the third party's
legal liability unless the amount reasonably expected to be recovered is less
than the cost of making the recovery. Notes
